cold_snaps.status: There is currently no cold snap.  This year there have been 6 cold snaps, usually there are 3.7 cold snaps per year.

extreme.status: The largest temperature difference recorded was 26.7°C on 29 April 2025.  On that date the temperature reached 27.1°C and fell to 0.4°C.

heatwave.status: There is currently no heatwave.  This year there have been 6 heatwaves, usually there are 1.9 heatwaves per year.

heaviest_rainfall.status: 13.04mm of rain was recorded as having fallen on 04 January 2025, marking an exceptional precipitation event and ranked 8th out of our records.  A rate of 8.6mm per hour was recorded during the 7.9 hour long storm.  The heaviest total rainfall to date occurred on 04 January 2025, dropping 27.64mm over the 15.9 hour storm duration with a maximum rate of 4.6mm per hour.

heaviest_rainrate.status: 27.0mm per hour was the peak rain rate recorded on 03 September 2025 ranking highest from our records.  The storm lasted 2.0 hours and 7.99mm of rain fell.

storm.status: The lengthiest precipitation event recorded spanned 23.2 hours on 23 November 2024, characterized by a peak rain intensity of 6.4mm per hour and a total rainfall of 24.56mm.
There is a storm in the vicinity.  This is the first storm since 02 September 2025.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: Currently experiencing a significant rainy period, ranked 5th longest since August 2024.  So far, it has lasted 9 consecutive days beginning 26 August 2025.  The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

tropical: The most recent tropical night was on 18 July 2025 and this has only occurred 62 times since 1973.

average.status: The current wind direction is south-westerly (204°), which is about average.  In the UK, a south-westerly wind often means mild and wet weather.

gusts.status: The highest wind gust ever seen was 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

run.status: The largest wind run ever was on 21 October 2012 with a value of 1754 miles.  The long-term average wind run is 229.42 miles and so far today the wind run is 76.85 miles.

speed.status: The largest wind speed ever was on 13 October 2012 with a value of 93.7 mph.

summary.description:
Today, a bit warmer for the feels like temperature (up 4.0°C) and outside temperature (up 3.1°C) and more moisture-laden rainfall (up 2.1 mm).

The past week and month had observable variation in cloud levels (up 1576 m) and inside temperature (up 2.1°C) when compared to today.

Today’s average cloud levels is 14.8m higher than yesterday, 472.5m lower than the past week, 1575.9m lower than the past month.

Yesterday’s cloud levels showed a low of 713m and a peak of 1594m, averaging 1081.8m; the week and month recorded warmer averages.

summary.summary: Inside; a mild and comfortable temperature is anticipated. Outside; the temperature will feel nicely warm and pleasant. Also, oppressively muggy and sticky and very little to no wind will be present. Rain showers likely, occasional overcast conditions, and bright intervals likely. The weather may change rapidly and become worse.
